title: 110_hr2963
content:
The "Pechanga Band of Luiseno Mission Indians Land Transfer Act of 2007" transfers Federal lands to the Pechanga Band of Luiseno Mission Indians in trust, excluding 12.82 acres of land and its facilities. The "Pechanga Band of Luiseno Mission Indians Land Transfer Act of 2007" transfers Federal lands to the Pechanga Band of Luiseno Mission Indians in trust, including the facilities and improvements associated with the existing 230 kV transmission line in San Diego County. The land will be sold to San Diego Gas & Electric Company for fair market value and administered as part of the Pechanga Indian Reservation. The "Pechanga Band of Luiseno Mission Indians Land Transfer Act of 2007" involves a memorandum of understanding between the tribe, Bureau of Land Management, and US Fish and Wildlife Service. The memorandum will remain in effect until the Western Riverside County Multiple Species Habitat Conservation Plan expires. Notification of termination must be given to the House Committee on Natural Resources and the Senate Committee on Indian Affairs at least 45 days in advance. The memorandum of understanding involves the Director of the Bureau of Land Management and the Pechanga Band of Luiseno Mission Indians notifying Congress of any termination or violation, except for the expiration of the Western Riverside County Multiple Species Habitat Conservation Plan. The lands in question cover approximately 1,178 acres in Riverside County, California, and San Diego County, California. The Pechanga Land Transfer Act involves the transfer of lands in Riverside County and San Diego County, California, previously administered by the Bureau of Land Management. The Act specifies the sections and surveys of the transferred lands and mandates a survey to establish boundaries within 180 days. Additionally, a utility corridor conveyance is outlined in the Act. The Pechanga Land Transfer Act mandates the conveyance of a utility corridor to San Diego Gas & Electric Company upon completion of a survey, receipt of rents and fees, and payment of fair market value determined by an appraisal. The Secretary will conduct an appraisal of the utility corridor after the survey is completed, following specific appraisal standards. San Diego Gas & Electric Company is responsible for the costs associated with the conveyance, including survey and appraisal costs. Any proceeds received will be deposited into the Federal Land Disposal Account. The Federal Land Transaction Facilitation Act requires a map to be filed with the Bureau of Land Management. Upon approval by the tribal council, legal descriptions of boundary lines and transferred lands will be published in the Federal Register. These legal descriptions will become official upon publication. (g) Rules of Construction: This Act does not affect the Pechanga Band of Luiseno Mission Indians' existing rights to land, water rights, or any rights-of-way issued before the enactment of this Act. 
(h) Restricted Use of Transferred Lands: The transferred lands can only be used for open space and the protection of archaeological, cultural, and wildlife resources. No roads, except for maintenance purposes, can be constructed on these lands. The land transferred under subsection (a) must be maintained as open space and cannot have any infrastructure or buildings developed on it. Maintenance purposes are allowed, but no other development is permitted. The land transferred must be maintained as open space for purposes such as protecting archaeological, cultural, and wildlife resources. The Pechanga Band of Luiseno Mission Indians are prohibited from conducting gaming activities or operating a casino on any land acquired under this Act. Utilities or structures can be built on the transferred land for the protection of archaeological, cultural, and wildlife resources. The Regulatory Act (25 U.S.C. 2701 et seq.) governs gaming activities for Native American tribes, with regulations from the Secretary or the National Indian Gaming Commission. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
